inn1.comm: Bresnan starts things off in unspectacular fashion, drifting too far down the leg side and it's a wide
much better second ball, bang on target, decent pace and Tamim defends
fortunate start for Tamim, Bresnan finds a hint of away movement off the wicket, finds the edge but it files wide of the solitary slip for four
over-corrects this time, shoving too far down leg side
tidy again, decent line, decent length and solidly defended
Bresnan bowled well in the first ODI at times, and has started tidily here, full and defended
Tamim is all wrists and elegance, and he's only defending
just back of a length on this occasion, defended solidly enough to complete the over
two slips in place, waiting for the outside edge, which Broad won't find from this line, drifting too far down the leg side for another wide
finds a better line and length this time, no great venom though, and nicely defended
this is a better ball, slightly fuller and Imrul looks a little uncomfortable in his defence
played neatly to point off the back foot, Broad dragging his length back a fraction
this first flashing blade of the morning, Imrul stretching forward a driving well, but straight to mid off
hint of extra bounce from a decent length, good line too, all of which amounts to a good delivery that Imrul jumps to defend and keep out
shorter ball, let's all hope Broad doesn't get bogged down in bowling short, but this gets up well and Imrul turns it off his hip, round the corner for one to complete a good opening over from Broad
back of a length again, Imrul rises with the delivery and drops it out on to the off side, looks for a run but the cover fielder swoops in too quickly
shortish again and it's nicely timed, round the corner down towards fine leg for a couple
better length this time, pitched up without being floated up, Imrul defends into the leg side
Bresnan is lucky to get away with this, short and with a hint of width, Imrul timed his cut nicely, but straight to point
back of a length again, into the hip area and it is defended
smart piece of fielding from Collingwood at point prevents runs from a fuller ball that was driven nicely into the off side
very badly disguised slower ball from Broad, big off cutter, turned calmly into the leg side
maintaining a very straight line of attack, England reluctant to give any width, defended once more
good ball this, finding some extra bounce from a decent length, Imrul hops to defend
this is good from England, much tighter than in the 1st ODI, bang on a length and line and can only be defended
another slower ball, pitched up, Imrul tries to drive it down the ground but can't quite time it. Pressure building on him here
attacking the body once more, Imrul tries to turn it into the leg side but misses, completes a very good over for England
Bresnan picks up where Broad left off, on a good line and length and neatly defended
slightly shorter and Tamim finally gets a chance to free his arms with a languid pull shot, doesn't quite time it and so smart, diving work from Broad keeps it to two
short again and Tamim has a bigger pull shot at it, connects well but it goes finer and Broad fields once more
shortish and defended into the leg side
Imrul will be getting annoyed with this, he's clipped a short ball very well, but straight to the fielder at point again
back of a length, defended once more
slightly fuller slower ball from Broad, glanced down to fine leg for a couple
Banged in, pulled, and Bresnan makes an absolute hash of what should have been a simple stop at fine leg. He went at the ball one-handed and it just spun past him
back of a length, another little cutter from Broad, and it's turned away to square leg
oh, good pace from Broad, pulled down short again and 138kph, that whizzes past Kayes's grill
fuller ball just outside off stump, looked like Broad was trying to find some swing there, but none on offer. Ball is driven straight to mid off
classy shot from Kayes, Broad drifts on to his pads and he finds the gap beautifully with a firm push off his hips. Top shot, and good to find the gap as he's picked out fielders repeatedly today
tapped into space on the off side and the batsmen scamper through for a tight single. Well judged in the end though, batsmen was well in
Bresnan digs the ball in on the off stump line, but Kayes simply drops his hands and watches the ball go past. Not much pace in this pitch.
on the hips, tucked firmly to leg but straight to the fielder
same line, but a bit more venom in this one from Bresnan, it comes off Kayes's glove, glances the thigh pad and almost rolls back onto the stumos
great shot! He's played the cut a few times today already, but finds the gap to perfection this time. Short, wide and punished
not too short, but Tamim rocks back and pulls the ball high in the air in front of midwicket, the ball drops into space but not enough on it to reach the rope
off stump line, back of a length, and played watchfully out to cover point
short and Tamim slashes very hard, the ball flies off the edge over the vacant slip area and the crowd cheer their appreciation as the ball rolls to the third man boundary
cutter from Broad, appeared to take the edge but fell well short of Prior
more back-of-a-length stuff and clipped straight to Collingwood at backward point
slightly fuller and on the pads, but Tamim can't find the gap in a packed leg side
Bresnan strays onto the pads and Kayes moves across to work the ball to fine leg. That ball appeared to keep slightly low
good running there, Tamim drops the ball into a big gap in the covers and the batsmen set off immediately. Quick single
on the pads again, Bresnan is feeding Kayes easy runs here as this is clipped down to fine leg
good shot! Not quite short enough for the pull but Tamim goes for it anyway, he finds the gap at midwicket but the fielder on the boundary cleans up well
slower cutter on leg stump, chipped slightly airily but wide of any fielders at square leg
slightly slower again, but on a length and tapped into the covers
crashed away! Broad gives Tamim far too much room outside off stump and that's smashed away with disdain

and Tamim goes next ball! He's just played such a good shot, but throws it away trying to heave a slower cutter over the leg side. A catching fielder has just been placed there at midwicket and he hardly had to move. Just the wicket England wanted, and a huge setback for Bangladesh
good pace from Broad to start, Ahmed pushes forward in slightly loose defence
pitched up on his legs and whipped away wristily, Tredwell makes a superb tumbling save on the boundary
back of a length, Kayes gets in line and defends back down the pitch
classy shot! He rocked back and drove off the back foot through the covers, picking the gap but not quite enough on the ball to reach the boundary.
and he begins the powerplay with a wide, spraying the ball down leg
straightish again and worked to leg but the fielder runs in from the fence to cut it off
and Bresnan sends down a good bouncer! Ahmed ducked under it easily though
into the midriff, but Ahmed moves across and glides the ball down to fine leg
some width given outside off stump, but hit straight to backward point
leg stump line again - Bresnan losing a bit of consistency here - and the ball is clipped easily out to deep square leg
silly shot! That's so disappointing from Aftab Ahmed. Pitched on a length, he runs down the wicket and swipes towards midwicket with his head in the air and the stumps are rattled.
dug in and the ball bounces up into the armpit area, but Kayes gets across and works the ball to short fine leg
another bouncer from Broad to Rahim first ball, he ducks underneath it
wider outside off, played off the face down to third man
another short ball, bounced more than Kayes expected and the ball pops up off the handle and loops gently but into space on the leg side
nice shot, uses the width on offer to guide the ball down to third man again, and looked good doing it
on a length just outside off stump and left alone by Kayes
good line from Bresnan, ball nips in just a touch but Rahim is solid in defence on the back foot
and same again, Rahim shapes to hit the ball to leg but defends again
pitched up this time, tailing in to the batsmen and Rahim drives  but the ball comes off the inside edge onto his shoe and trickles away
similar ball but Rahim whips to leg this time, a lot of wrist in that shot. Well played, but he did leave a big gap between bat and pad there
some width outside off and Kayes flashes at it. Ball scoots past the outside edge to Prior
and he's almost given a chance straight away! Kayes fiddles at the ball outside off, it takes the edge but drops just short of Swann, eluding him on its way to the third man boundary
tossed up, just a touch of turn, and defended carefully just behind square
straighter, and with all the fielders on the boundary worked easily into space at square leg
some turn, defended and the ball comes off the outside half of the bat to backward point
squared him up there, Kayes goes back to defend but played the turn a little awkwardly
pitched up on leg stump, driven between mid on and midwicket
slightly shorter, Rahim moves back and away to give himself room to cut but finds the close fielder
and he's on the spot straight away, zoning in on off stump and defended off the front foot
same again, and Kayes gets in line to defend to leg
just outside off stump, driven off the back foot but not timed at all and the ball rolls slowly to mid off
more room given outside off and Kayes flashes hard, but the the timing's not great again and he picks out the fielder infront of point to perfection
aimed straight at the stumps this time, defended
pulled just a touch short, worked to leg and the batsmen set off for a single. Sharp throw from Tredwell though, and the umpire asks the third umpire to have a look. No harm done.
nicely flighted by Swann, Imrul stretches forward and defends
collects a single, turning his wrists over the ball into the leg side
outside off stump and wristily defended
nicely played, couple of skips down the wicket and clipped firmly down the ground to rotate the strike
good running again, dropped into the off side off the front foot
Swann finds some spin from a rather short ball, well outside off, Mushfiqur gets back and tries to cut, but it cramps him for room
Imrul is defending again, looking solid, but a touch to slow as well
decent length ball from the bustling Wright, Imrul does what he's done all day really, defend
fuller and Imrul stretches out to meet it, defending down the ground
Wright must feel like Glenn McGrath out there, Imrul takes a straight ball and works it gently to leg
sticking in the pitch a fraction, Imrul attempts something resembling an attacking drive, doesn't time it and Wright fields
sequence of dots is broken by a perfectly played inside edge that squeezes out down towards fine leg, and he'll keep the strike
Swann is bang on target after the break, and Imrul is defending
couple of steps down the track, and a stylish drive, but straight to the fielder
Swann drifts a fraction towards leg stump and Imrul gets down on one knee and sweeps powerfully for four, top shot, that will release the pressure a bit
follows it up with a good single, turning into the leg side to rotate the strike
good from Bangladesh, clipping towards backward square for another single
driven into the off side to complete a good over for Bangladesh
good length and defended well into the off side
good from Wright, giving nothing away to Imrul here, who can only pop forward and defend
having just praised him, Wright shoves one down the leg side, clipping the pad on the way down towards fine leg
tight line this time, Imrul back and defending towards mid on
fuller from Wright, Imrul comes out to meet it and plays an inside-edged on drive that squirts through midwicket for a couple
Imrul finally gets on of his back-foot forcing shots away, driving down past mid on for a single
Swann finds a line and some flight and Imrul stretches forward to defend
that is a good shot for none, neat back cut but straight to short third man
pressure beginning to tell, Imrul gives himself room and tries to launch this over cover, misses by a distance as the ball spins past the bat
gets away from the strike with a cut shot that beats point and is fielded by the sweeper on the off side
nicely played, waiting on the ball and turning it round the corner but straight to the fielder at short fine leg
stretches forward and defends to complete another excellent over from Swann
Luke Wright bustles in, what a cheery run up he has. Imrul defends a good-length ball on middle
nicely played, taken a slightly shorter ball from leg stump and forced gently into the leg side down towards square leg
too short again from Wright, allows Imrul to ride the bounce and turn it fine, for another single
good ball, probing off stump, not much the batsman can do about that apart from defend
Matt Prior's wicketkeeping continues to be a revelation. Wright shoves this down the leg side, and Prior, standing up to the stumps, collects and whips the bails off in a flash
back on off stump and defended into the covers
that's good from Mushfiqur, pierces the off side with a drive and collects a single to deep cover
lovely shot from Mushfiqur, skipping down the wicket, meeting it on the half volley and driving straight back over Swann's head for a boundary
follows up the classical drive with a sweep and some sprightly running gets them back for two
good intent from Mushfiqur, coming at Swann, and driving down the ground but the bowler intercepts
clipped firmly back to Swann
good sweep shot, taken from well outside off down to deep square
keeps the strike with a neat clip down to long on, really well done by Mushfiqur this over
Mushfiqur has found his range here, timing the ball nicely as he guides this down to third man for a single
Imrul rotates the strike with a similar shot, taken from around off stump and worked down to third man
gets forward and tries to drop it into the off side for a quick single but cover swoops in too quickly
nicely bowled by Wright, bang on a line and length and Mushfiqur can only defend
Mushfiqur will feel he missed out there, Wright angled in towards leg but the leg glance went straight to short midwicket
completes a tidy over with a probing off-stump delivery that Mushfiqur pokes into the off side
he'll be happy with that, decent line and length and defended
quite quick and flat, but finds the right line and Imrul can only defend
pitched up and Imrul mistimes a drive back to Tredwell
almost a first wicket for the debutant, Imrul chips it towards point where a diving Cook can't quite reach it
oh close again! Big appeal as Imrul attempted a heave into the leg side, but the umpire declines. Looked very close
finally gets one away, clipping into space for one
Wright continues his good work, probing a tight line around off and Imrul defends
given a little width Imrul flashes but straight to the point fielder
Imrul manufacturing something here, giving himself space and driving through the off side, good work from him
taken from around off and worked towards deep point to keep the board ticking
back of a length delivery on off, Rahim pulls it to deep mid wicket, does not time that well, just a single
massive appeal from a Wight slower ball as Imrul misses an attempted leg-side tickle, but it pitched outside leg
nicely bowled from Tredwell, a touch slower and landing well outside off, defended into the off side
on off stump again and it is worked into space for a single
good ball, round-the-wicket approach, pitching around off stump, Imrul defends
a touch shorter and wider, allows Imrul a cut shot, which isn't timed perfectly and goes out for one
good tight line again and it's worked away into the off side for one
defended towards cover from a good length for a sharp single
starts well, around off stump, no pace and defended tidily
touch fuller, Imrul drives it down the ground to bring up an important fifty. Not full of glittering strokes but he's anchored the innings so far
a fraction too far down the leg side allows the batsman to work it down to fine leg for a couple
gets well forward and defends towards cover
fuller this time, allows a nicely-timed drive down to long on
taken off his legs from a fullish length and worked towards square leg, some excellent running allows two
nicely bowled from Tredwell, just held it back a fraction, top-edge sweep goes in the air but one bounce to deep midwicket
Imrul stretches and defends
oh my, that is a hideous swipe at a slightly short ball, missed it by a mile, looked really horrid
big appeal from another sweep shot, but the umpire and the bowler are not really that interested and replays shot it missing off
good shot, gave himself room and checked his drive perfectly, chipping it one the bounce out to deep extra cover
finishes the over well, working this down the ground for another single
Collingwood balls an off cutter, which is defended from the front foot
another cutter, plenty of those from him, driven nicely down the ground for one
well pitched up, met with a full-faced forward defence
good stuff from Collingwood this, the batsman can only defend but it grips on the pitch and finds the inside edge

dropped oh my, what an absolute howler! Stuart Broad drops the simplest of chances at deep square leg from a top-edged sweep. Tried to take it with his fingers pointing up, but went through his hands, hit him on the face and well to the ground
attempted sweep is missed
good stuff from Tredwell, accurate, if not threatening, and it's defended
worked away into space for single
well bowled again and it's defended
gives himself a bit of room, trying to open out the off side, drives nicely for a single
worked down to deep square for one
attempted pull goes for one
round the wicket, he slips down leg and is worked away
just outside off and Rahim misses an attempted late cut. 55 balls since the last boundary now
straighter and slightly quicker, Rahim pushes the ball down the ground for a single
glanced away very fine on the leg side, Bresnan makes a diving stop to keep it to three
given some room outside off, Rahim steps away and cuts hard out to the point sweeper
another over without a boundary. Kayes works a length ball to the leg side but straight to the fielder at wide mid on
defended watchfully to off. Pressure beginning to mount
down the track but defended once more
swept in the air, going for the gap between long on and midwicket, but it's top edged slightly, falling safe
great fielding off his own bowling, Kayes pushed it back firmly
swept out to deep backward square
big turn on that one! It was slightly short and Rahim rocked back and away, the ball turned in to him but he had made enough room to be able to work it away
the pressure comes off at last! Great sweep from Rahim, he hit the ball very hard and purposefully in front of square to find the gap
another good-looking shot, slammed down to long on and they scamper through for two
outside off and doesn't turn at all, Rahim goes for the cut and the ball comes off the outside edge down to third man. Valuable runs for Bangladesh here
steps to the offside to change the angle and work the ball away through square leg. Rahim batting sensibly here, needs to carry it on though
great ball, really tight line and a touch of turn. Kayes can't get it away

what a catch! That's a classic catch from Collingwood, Kayes stepped to leg to give himself room, the ball was pitched up and really flighted. He went for a booming drive through the covers but Collingwood dived to his right to hold a stinging catch. That was hit really hard, but Kayes goes after a good innings
a couple of steps down the track, and he meets the ball on the half volley to drive powerfully to the cover sweeper
swept, but straight to short fine leg
that looked slightly quicker through the air, possibly an arm ball, and it's hit straight to mid on
swept to the left of fine leg this time, and the batsmen run a sharp single
tossed up on middle stump, Shakib drives it hard back at the bowler
straying slightly to leg, Shakib leans on it and they grab a single as the ball rolls away on the leg side
tossed up outside off, some turn out there but tapped safely to point off the front foot
full and spinning away from the left-hander again, tapped away
Shakib gives himself some room to cut, but finds the fielder
driven in the air! That spun a lot , Shakib didn't quite cover the turn and ended up driving airily just short of point
quicker, driven down the ground to long off
leg stump line, nurdled easily to square leg
swept away hard, fielder at square leg collects and hurls it in
strong shot! Shakib hacks a slog sweep, but connects well and finds the gap in front of square
that's much better! Similar shot but he timed this one even better
just hangs back in the crease, waits for the turn and clips the ball into space on the off side
dances down the track and aims a firm push at long on, Tredwell dives but can't stop it
staying back in the crease again, punched through the covers.
tapped in front of point, he timed that quite well actually but there's a fielder out there
such a soft dismissal! Shakib drove towards long on, but the turn on the ball took the leading edge and he ended up chipping it ever so softly back at Swann
full, Mahmudullah drives hard at his first ball but can't time it
too straight from Swann, worked easily behind square on the leg side
Rahim taps it away behind square leg, but Mahmudullah turns down the single. Wise decision
pushed down the ground on the leg side, safe shot
flighted, Rahim comes forward to defend with a straight bat
and that completes a good fifty for Rahim. He uses his feet, dropping the ball into the covers and they run through for a tight single. Vital innings this
big turn, Mahmudullah steps to the off to work it away, but straight to fine leg
firm push into the covers, but finds the fielder once again
good over from Tredwell, slightly quicker ball and defended
on the off stump line once again, Mahmudullah defends
slowish, on off stump, Rahim drives but straight to mid off. The timing wasn't great either
deft touch! Rahim hangs back and makes the most of a tiny amount of width on off stump with a delicate late cut
slog swept in the air, fortunately for him he timed it really badly as the ball fell in the gap between the close fielders and those on the boundary
beats batsmen keeper and stumps! Welcome runs for Bangladesh, the cutter didn't turn as much as expected and kept a touch low
straightish, worked to leg
quicker, firmly pushed down to long on
down the track and he hammers the ball down to long off. It was in the air but never got up high, well struck
reverse sweep beats the fielder at 45, but he didn't get quite enough on it to reach the boundary
sharp turn, but Tredwell starts too straight and the ball is tapped to midwicket
Rahim backs away, chops a cut out to cover point and they run a quick two. Good running
aims for a slog sweep but doesn't quite connect, Morgan picks it up at deep midwicket but they scamper another two
down the track again, Tredwell saw him coming and pulled the ball down shorter, but Rahim managed to nudge it away
shapes to sweep early, Collingwood saw him and threw it well outside off, good correction from the batsman sends it down to third man with a cut, where a sprawling stop saves the boundary
altogether more straightforward this time, driven down the ground
another big sweep shot attempted, doesn't get much of it, but it goes out to deep square for another single
fuller and an attempted work into the leg side is missed
uses the width on offer to drive to deep cover for a single
not a great delivery this, waist high full toss that should really have been smacked out of Dhaka, as it was, the pull was not timed very well and it went down to fine leg
top shot from Mushfiqur, skipping down the track and driving handsomely over Tredwell for a boundary
good follow up to the boundary, milking it behind square on the leg side for a single
big cheer from the crowd as this is lumped from leg stump round the corner for a single to bring up the 200
very correct forward defence from Mushfiqur, pushed into the off side
great shot this time and the crowd are loving it. Mushfiqur gets down on one knee and heaves Tredwell well in front of square for a one-bounce four. Ruining Tredwell's figures
Tredwell finishes his first bowling stint with a shortish ball outside off that is driven to the covers
he's bowled well today and starts with a good ball outside off that is flashed, off the outside edge down to third man
good tight bowling from Wright, bustling in and skidding it on, this is bang on middle and defended into the leg side
can't get him away, leaning forward and defending
this is nicely driven through the off side for a single, they should really be taking the batting Powerplay at this stage. Why wait for the final five?
slower ball, and a good change of length, dragging it shorter, an attempted pull finds no timing and trickles back to Wright
excellent over from Wright, but he's helped by the senseless decision to save the Powerplay, this is driven to mid off and the batsmen scamper a single
starts well, on a line and length and well defended
another good ball, full on off stump and Mushfiqur can't get it away
Bresnan won't mind this, Mushfiqur works it away towards square leg, but it's only for one
Mahmudullah looks to give himself some room and smash it through the off side, but can't quite time it and it goes straight to cover
much slower ball, drifting slightly too far down leg side
lucky to get away with this, high full toss but it's tickled round the corner for one

Luke Wright takes an excellent catch to end a superb innings from Mushfiqur, slower ball from Bresnan, Mushfiqur read it and tried to flick it into the leg side, but was still a fraction early on the shot and it looped towards mid on where Wright scooted to his left and took the sliding catch
Luke Wright continues to bowl well, bang on target and defended. It's a shame for Bangladesh that Mushfiqur isn't there for the Powerplay overs
worked away into space for a single to Naeem
doesn't quite time this, outside off and defended
drifts slightly too far down leg allows a work towards midwicket
can't quite get the big shots away, just worked for a single, the innings in danger of ending with a whimper
another single to finish off, excellent over from Wright
tidy start for Swann, full and it's clipped down the ground for one
landing this outside off and it's only pushed into the covers for one
yet another single, no big shot as yet, just turned round the corner for a single
clever bowling, slightly quicker ball, the batsman can doing nothing but defend
finally the big shot is attempted, but the flashing drive from Naeem is well stopped by Wright at cover
oh dear, this is far too tame from Bangladesh, excellent from Swann though. Tapped gently and aimlessly into the leg side
good from Bresnan, full and straight and it's worked down the ground for a single
more intent here, skipping down the wicket and trying to swot it over leg but doesn't get much of it and it goes down the ground
slower ball, attempted leg-side heave, but it goes straight to the fielder out at deep midwicket
ooops, gets this very wrong, shoving it miles down the leg side
recovers well here, full and straight, but just pushed into the off side
excellent yorker, the first real one, no space for anything big from the batsman
good yorker to finish, beats the batsman and Prior, who appears to have hurt his fingers
reverse-sweep attempted, a little bit too fancy, doesn't time it but collects a couple
nothing here, trying to smack this through the off side but finds the cover fielder
this is a better attempt, edging down the crease and trying to heave it over midwicket, but he gets too close to it and can't time it
not much here again, pushed into the off side for one
finally a boundary! Swann lands it a long way outside off, the batsman leans back and clubs it through extra cover for four
Mahmudullah can't do much with this, tickled round the corner for one
good stuff from Bresnan, full straight and rattles the stumps. Mahmudullah looking for a swipe into the leg side but misses
he's away straight away, stylishly working into the off side, more style than smash though
this is good from Naeem, leans back a thumps a good-length ball past mid off four a much-needed boundary
just a single here, shortish again, Naeem tries to smack it through the off side but finds the fielder at cover
good from Suhrawadi, just giving Naeem the strike by pushing it into the off side
Naeem delivers, swiping a shortish slower ball through midwicket where Liam Plunkett attempts a sliding stop but doesn't cut it off
that will do for Bangladesh, Suhrawadi gets off strike, missing a leg side heave and scampering one
not very much and he's fuming, can only push a full ball gently into the covers
Suhrawadi takes it past 250 in style! On debut he smashes this full ball miles over long on for six! Sensational strike
tries to repeat the stroke, but it goes much squarer out to deep midwicket
good yorker from Wright, Naeem can't do much but squeeze it into the off side for a single
Suhrawadi Shuvo finishes it style! Full toss from Wright and it was smashed powerfully between deep midwicket and long on for four

inn2.comm: pacy ball first up, just back of a length on off stump and punched firmly into space
dropped! Kieswetter is dropped by Rahim first ball, pushing forward to a fullish ball he gets a thickish edge which flies between keeper and slip. Another let-off on nought for Kieswetter

he's gone this time! Kieswetter advances down the pitch to a similar ball as the previous one and goes for a drive. The edge was thicker this time and flew fast and low to slip, who clung on. First blood to Bangladesh!
full and straight first ball, Pietersen drives firmly to mid on
great ball! A pacy, rising delivery outside off stump whizzes past the edge of Pietersen's bat, and the crowd go wild!
slower ball, pushed into the covers
starts by angling one across Cook, a loosener which the England captain lets go
ooh, Cook has a little nibble to a length ball on off stump. Play and a miss, and the crowd roar their appreciation
much better shot from Cook, struck firmly but straight at the extra cover fielder
much fuller ball with some nip, Cook drives carefully to mid off
pushed out to mid off once again, Cook very watchful out there
Cook finds the gap with a square drive, on the up. Great timing there, he didn't try to hit it too hard and placed it perfectly, once the ball was past the fielders it raced away
nice and straight, the ball skidded on to Pietersen, who got behind it in solid defence
more width on that one and Pietersen punches off the back foot through extra cover, Razzak chases the ball down before the rope
bang on target, and good pace too. Shafiul collects the ball in his follow through and threatens the non-strikers stumps, but Pietersen was well in
another good ball, on off stump and a little inside edge rolls off the pad into the off side
maintaing the good line, but Cook is up to the challenge, getting in line nicely and drives, but straight to mid off
punched straight back down the wicket, Shafiul attempts a diving stop and gets a hand on the ball as mid off runs round to cut it off
strong shot, pitched up and slammed at mid off. Well fielded
Pietersen moves across and gets his head over a length ball, played down in defence
that was very close! Pietersen charges down the track, trying to flick the ball through midwicket but the ball takes the inside edge, just missing the stumps on its way to the fine leg boundary
pushed firmly just to mid on's left, and the batsmen take the chance for a sharp single
full, wide, and put away in style. There isn't enough swing to be bowling like that, and Cook took full advantage, silencing the large crowd
full again, but straight, and Cook punches a bottom-handed drive at mid off. A slight misfield, but they wisely decide not to risk a run
solid shot, not looking to do anything special is Pietersen, just searching for timing, and he pushes this one off the back foot straight to short extra cover
down the track and bunted straight back at the bowler, who fumbles the ball, but no run taken
back of a length and Pietersen rides the skiddy bounce easily, tapping the ball down towards mid on
slower ball, looked like an offcutter, Pietersen forward in defence
bouncer! Good intent by the bowler there, refusing to back down, but Pietersen sways away with time to spare
dances down the track once again, and tucked through the gap between midwicket and mid on
dug in short but doesn't get up, riding the low bounce to work the ball to leg. Rubel has a really slingy action
Pietersen moves down the wicket and across to change the angle, allowing him to work the ball behind square on the leg side for a single
full toss, and Cook can't capitalise - he ends up just tapping it softly back to the bowler
too short and on Cook's hip, I think he was trying to set Cook up there but he pulled the ball easily wide of the fielder to the boundary
full and Cook swipes to leg, picking the gap and two runs to go with it
that's kept a touch low! Hits the bottom of Pietersen's bat, as he stoops low to keep the ball out. Slightly over dramatic from KP, one might say. It didn't keep that low
solid strike! Length ball pitching on off and angled across, Cook just hits through the line and bisects the fielders perfectly

another boundary, but that should have been out! Cook pulled a short ball in the air towards midwicket, but the fielder runs in much too far and misjudges the catch, the ball flying over his outstretched hands
and that'll be painful for the bowler. He attempts the slower ball, pitching it up, but Cook slams the ball powerfully through the covers and the ball races away
angled in to Cook, who tucks it off his hips but - luckily for the bowler - picks out short fine leg
straighter, and dropped close on the leg side
good ball to finish the over, pacy on off stump from around the wicket, but Cook is equally good in defence
good ball to start. Flighted up on middle stump, and already a hint of turn
tossed up on off stump this time, and Pietersen drives off the front foot to deep mid off
Razzak's really flighting them so far, and Cook works this one away to mid on
too short there, Cook rocks back and tucks the ball to leg, just wide of fine leg and they snatch a single
slightly quicker through the air, Pietersen hangs back and tries to flat bat it back down the wicket, mistimed
pitched up on off and driven very firmly, but the cover fielder is there to stop it and prevent any runs
round the wicket to Cook, a touch short and no turn at all, Cook pulls out to deep midwicket
good ball, straight and on a tantalising length, but not much turn yet
just too straight there, the ball didn't bounce much but Pietersen tucked it away into space for one
too short and on the legs as well, Cook plays a risk-free shot to deep midwicket
ooh, play and a miss! Quite wide and Pietersen goes for a flashing cut. The ball goes on with the arm though
slammed back past Naeem. Too short again and Pietersen just cleared the left leg and hammered the ball to straightish long on. Powerful shot
wide and Cook slashes hard, but meets fresh air
straighter and Cook goes for the slog sweep. Possibly some glove on that, but the ball bobbled past Cook and the keeper to slip
full and straight, Cook nurdles to leg

Gone! Delivered from round the wicket, pitching on leg and turning sharply. Pietersen played all round the turn to be struck on the back leg plumb in front. And Razzak breaks his wicketless run - which had stretched to 45 overs in international cricket - with the huge wicket of Pietersen
flighted from round the wicket, Collingwood leans forward in defence
another good ball, pushed to leg but straight at the fielder
around the wicket, pitching outside off and Cook plays an awkward-looking swipe across the line to get one to long on
tossed up on leg stump, tapped to midwicket
and again, same ball, same shot
Collingwood goes straight this time, punching firmly back at the bowler but Shakib collects
huge shout! But what is it for? Ball was fired down leg, glancing the pad before the keeper caught it. Rightfully turned down by the umpirev
pushed down to long off
pitched up on leg, Collingwood gets the nurdle out as they scamper a single
just a touch too short there, tapped to long on off the back foot
fuller on off stump, forward in defence
dropped! Collingwood comes down the wicket to chip to wide long on, put down by Mahmudullah at midwicket
short but couldn't capitalise, chopped down hard
driven off a thick outside edge down to third man
comes forward and squeezes a thick inside edge between his legs and away to backward square
pushed across the left hander, driven without much timing into the covers
full on off stump, driven straight past the stumps but mid off comes around to keep them to a single
comes half forward and finds backward point with an open face
gee, what was that from Colly? He came down the pitch and lost all control of his shot as he tried to whip it through the leg side and finished playing a horrid swipe
dragged down short on leg stump, Cook stays deep in his crease and pulls out to deep square-leg who is nearly beaten by a mixture of dew and spin
tucked neatly off leg stump and it's a comfortable brace
stands tall and punches down to long off

it's in the air and Cook almost picks out the fielder again. He swings it away over deep midwicket, but the fielder scurrying around can't make it as the ball drops about ten yards away from him...heart in mouth stuff for the captain
dragged down again and pulled strongly out to deep square-leg
gone! What a moment for Bangladesh, this is their chance to notch a win against England. Collingwood goes down for the sweep and is caught in front. Razzaq goes crazy as do the crowd
worked off leg stump into midwicket
tossed up on middle, driven gently back down the pitch
what a sweet shot to start with, driven with perfect timing wide of mid off and it was little more than a push from Morgan
worked off the pads down to short fine-leg
cut hard into the off side, turns into a bit of a scampered single but Morgan is safe enough in the end
short outside off, cut away to the deep cover sweeper
on off stump, pushed back down the pitch
whipped away through the on side out to deep midwicket
driven wide of the bowler but mid on is in quickly to prevent a single
uses his feet but turns this into a yorker and can only find cover
boy oh boy that looked close, huge appeal from Mahmudullah and it squares Morgan up but it's not given. That turned into a plead from the bowler
cut away into the off side as he keeps the strike
worked off middle down to mid on
stops a little on the pitch as Morgan pushes into a drive
swung away hard over midwicket, a confident stroke from Morgan to break the shackles a little...he has such strong forearms that he just punches the ball
driven down to long off
tucked away for another single as they rotate the strike
worked out to midwicket as this pair take time to consolidate
comes forward and defends to the off side
can't find a gap in the off side as he tries to play with the spin
gets off the strike this time as he drives down to long off
uses his wrists to open the face but can't place the ball wide of a fielder
steps back into his crease and cuts out to deep cover
just a touch short at the moment, gives Cook the chance to cut away through point
on leg stump, takes the pad into the leg side
whipped from middle and off into the on side, goes to the left of mid on who slides to do the fielding
good line, doesn't given Morgan any room and it's defended into the off side
back of a length, hits the bat quite hard as Morgan punches down to mid off
goes fuller on off stump and Morgan can't time his drive as it comes off the toe end of his bat
tucked off leg stump, just wide enough of midwicket so that they can hurry through
cut away into the covers
another sweep causes alarm as Morgan is struck low on the pad and again the appeal is turned down...ooh, that was very close
pushed back to the bowler
steps back and finds the gap out to deep cover
drifts down the leg side and it misses the pad
driven down to long off
chips this down the ground, has he got too much on it? No, the ball lands in front of long off running in so Morgan can breath again...he actually played it with just the right amount of power
Cook tries to mow this into the leg side, but it was a touch to full for the stroke and it crashed into his midriff
gets it away this time Rubel Hossain dragging it down a touch and Cook smashed it through midwicket to bring up an excellent 50, at almost a run a ball. Not bad for a Twenty20 reject
gets back and defends this into the leg side
well bowled from Rubel, probing off stump and Cook tries to flick it into the leg side but can't get it away
slightly too close to the legs and Cook pokes it down towards fine leg
back of a length, around off stump, Morgan caresses it through towards the sweeper on the cover boundary
big reverse-sweep attempted, connects only with fresh air
played more conventionally, patted down the pitch
worked into the leg side
fuller and Morgan tries to drive down the ground but can't time it
Morgan bogged down here against Shakib, tries to work it to leg but finds the fielder
excellent maiden over from Shakib, Morgan unable to pierce the infield, fascinating stuff
another dot ball as Cook tries but fails to cut into the leg side
superb from Cook, sensing the pressure building he goes down on one knee and hoiks this powerfully over midwicket for six
rocks back and forces into the off side but can't beat the infield
gets a single this time, pushing into space
Morgan still not quite finding his range, aiming and missing a sweep
good from Cook here, dropping it into the off side and setting off straight away for a sharp single

Mushfiqur Rahim finally holds on to one and it's crucial! Shakib gets his opposite number, as Cook rocks back and feathers a top-edge through to the keeper. Massive wicket and England are in real trouble.
Prior deflects this into the leg side
stretches forward and prods into the off side
worked into the leg side, but no run on offer there
probing stuff again, Prior doesn't start well against spin, gets forward and defends
another maiden, wicket maiden this time for Shakib, Prior prods this into the off stump and Bangladesh are all over England at the moment
starts well, Morgan pushes it into the leg side
Prior gets back and defends in a hurry into the off side
breaks the shackles by timing a gentle push, past the bowler for a single
Morgan plays this well, deflecting it round the corner for a single to short fine leg
poor delivery, dragged down and well wide of off stump, luckily for Abdur, Prior finds deep point
nicely deflected for runs down to midwicket
Morgan is still trying to be inventive, reverse-sweeping at fresh air, but it beats the keeper and goes through for two
better from Morgan, playing down the ground but can't beat Shakib
Morgan finally gets Shakib away, turning him down to fine leg, for a single
tries to work this down the ground but can't get through the infield
couple of skips down the track, opening space into the off side, but Shakib is skiddy and difficult to get away
no run here either, Prior drives, but straight to the fielder
Morgan times this well, sweeping firmly to deep square, but straight to the fielder on the boundary so it's just a single
close here, Prior misreading the length and missing the ball, it thuds off the pads for a run
Morgan on the sweep again, plays it well enough to earn a single
Prior attempting a panicked sweep, really swiping at it, and a massive appeal but turned down
driven nicely this time, through the covers and a sliding stop on the boundary saves the four
Prior tries to give himself a bit of room and drive through the off side, but picks out cover and the pressure mounts
quicker ball from Shakib, Morgan deflected it well, fine past the keeper and they scamper back for three important runs
well bowled from Shakib, skidding on and Prior rushes into his shot, pushing on the leg side
this is well played, driven through the covers
calmly done from Morgan, leaning this through mid on for an easy single
intriguing sub plot developing between Shakib and Prior, again the batsman is advancing and again he can't get it away
pressure builds as Prior can't get this flat, quicker ball away
starts tidily enough, on a length and good line pushed into the off side
calmly worked around into the midwicket region for one
Prior can't find the single, prods this to leg but finds the fielder
gets the single this time, pushing back down the ground for one
Morgan is looking a touch more settled now, pushing into space for a single
Prior tries to give himself room to smash it through the off side, finds the fielder and the batsmen have to really scoot to get through for one
well bowled again from Shakib, Prior looking rushed on his stroke, prods into the leg side
lovely shot from Prior, gives himself room and times a lofted drive between extra cover and long on for a pressure-releasing boundary
stretches forward and defends, he can afford that now
skips up the wicket and clips it into the leg side for a single
neatly done from Morgan, working this round gently to short fine leg, enough time to run a quick single
Prior's heart would be in his mouth for a moment here, he edged down the wicket and drove airily, but it was well wide of short extra cover
tossed up on middle and off, tapped away in watchful defence
really round-arm on that, Prior uses the extra angle to work the ball away past mid on
swept powerfully away to deep square leg
on the toes, Prior clips it away but finds midwicket
swept hard, but out to the sweeper. Bangladesh won't mind these singles too much
turning in slightly, well played wide of long on
round the wicket to the left-hander, ball dies as Morgan defends
full, Morgan moves forward to power the ball away to long on
swept well, but finds the sweeper once again
chipped in the air to wide long on, falls safely into space between the fielders
Morgan hangs back in his crease, waiting on the ball and chopping it down just wide of the close third man fielder

close! Prior comes down the wicket and chips the ball high in the air towards long off. The fielder ran in hard but couldn't quite get to it, the ball bouncing just infront of him. Half a chance there
back of a length on middle and off, from over the wicket. Morgan gets behind the ball to defend it under his eyes
shortish again and pulled hard and high over square leg. Really powerful shot, never got up very high but cleared the boundary by several metres
fuller and just outside off, he just clips the ball down behind point
full again, and not much bounce. Prior plays across his pads but connects, sending the ball to the leg side
much better length from Shafiul after that massive pull, Morgan pushes the ball to midwicket
half-volley outside off stump, Morgan times it well but picks out the cover sweeper
tossed up very high, Morgan chips the ball out to midwicket
delivered from a low angle from wide of the crease, no run
from wide of the crease again, but this is too full and too straight, and pushed down to long on
easy runs for Morgan, he drives a full ball to long off
flighted again, but leaking the singles here, pushed down to long on
that's the length! Pulls the ball back just a touch and Morgan is forced into a defensive push. Bangladesh need more of that
beautiful ball to start! Beats the bat and the wicketkeeper, didn't turn that much but the flight was spot on
full again and pushed back to the bowler
another dot, Bangladesh need to keep them coming. Straight to extra cover
good, tight ball, full and straight and Prior taps it back to Naeem
a pressure-relieving reverse sweep! Well executed, that was hit away powerfully but all along the carpet
and he follows it up by missing the next ball completely. Close to the edge, but no alarm
swept very hard, but the fielder sweeping at square leg runs round to cut it off well
flighted and Morgan pushes the ball down the ground to get to 49
round the wicket, Prior leans back and punches the ball wide of the fielder at extra cover
another sweep, but straight to the fielder at deep square leg this time, and that's his half-century. He's made the most of surviving those lbw calls
pitched up and forced down to long off
pushed wider from around the wicket, Morgan has a tickle outside off but misses, and is lucky not to get an edge on that
straying down leg and clipped firmly way, they run very hard for the two
good ball, Prior rocks back but defends
a couple of steps down the track and slashed square on the off side
just a bit too straight, easily nudged to long on by Morgan
another reverse sweep, he makes a good connection but the ball goes too square and straight out to the sweeper on the off side
full and Morgan steps down the wicket to drive out through the covers
ooh, close call there! Prior steps away to cut and the ball keeps low, chops it right off the stumps
driven to long off for an easy one
good ball, slightly quicker through the air and turning in a touch, nudged to the close midwicket fielder
Morgan skips down the track and chips down to long on
Razzak fires one in on the pads, Prior moves across and sweeps strongly to midwicket. Top shot
misfield! Tapped straight to point, the fielder runs in but runs over the ball. Bangladesh beginning to crack here
aimed at leg stump, Prior moves across to tap the ball out to square leg
handsome reverse sweep! Morgan is starting to make it look easy now, as he hammers a reverse sweep to the boundary
uppish! But wide of the bowler and out to long off
Prior dances down the wicket but can't get to the pitch, the spin taking the ball past the bat and thudding into his pads
full and wide, Prior gets down on one knee to crunch the ball to the cover boundary. It's all falling apart for Bangladesh now
much better ball, defended back down the wicket
Morgan moves across to the off side and nudges to leg, but straight at the fielder
and that's pulled down way too short, Morgan pulls hard but there's cover on the boundary

Razzak strikes! That was absolutely plumb! It could have been an arm ball, didn't turn at all but came in slightly with the arm, Prior played across it - perhaps expecting the ball to turn - and Bangladesh get an lbw decision in their favour!
tossed up on Wright's toes, clipped behind square leg and theres some confusion with the calling out there. No harm done though
very full, yorker length almost and dug out back to the bowler
strays onto his pads and Wright whips the ball out in the gap between deep square leg and midwicket
skidding on, Morgan tries to give himself room, doesn't time it well through the off side and collects one
drives this ball with no timing back to the bowler
Wright aims a massive sweep, doesn't get much of it and it trickles away for one
Morgan on the sweep this time, and he too swishes mainly at fresh air
back of a length and tries to hit it through point, but doesn't time it
slightly shorter, allows Morgan to wait on it and turn it calmly into the midwicket region
excellent work from Morgan, he's very comfortable with this shot, reverse-sweeping powerfully, beating short third man and collecting four
follows it up with a tickle round the corner for a couple more
too much width outside off, allows Morgan to guide it down to third man
horrid ball, tried a quicker and flatter one but it went well down leg, and Wright will be annoyed to have missed out
quick hands, quick bustling hands from Luke Wright, swishing at his drive and getting it away nicely down the ground
prodded gently from a length into the leg side
on the reverse-sweep once more, gets more or less an inside edge which comes off the keeper to short third man
swept neatly for a single down to fine leg
nicely played by Wright, skipping eagerly down the wicket and clipping into the leg side for a single
Morgan edges down the track and works it into the leg side, rotating the strike well here England
delicacy is not normally attributed to Wright's batting, but this was very dandy, poked into the leg side for a quick single
Morgan can dob and dash equally well, this time he dobs into the leg side, so gently that the batsmen have time to cross for two
on the sweep again, doesn't really get much of it, thuds off the pads for a swift single
starts with a slightly short one, slung down at Morgan who pulls mainly off a bottom edge down to deep midwicket for a single
Luke Wright has morphed into Paul Collingwood, nurdling into the leg side superbly for one
easily milked down the ground for another one, things looking very ominous for Bangladesh
Wright is skipping down the wicket again, possibly looking for a big shot, but ends up driving to mid off
Shakib does it again! Horrid shot from Wright, swishing aimlessly and needlessly across the line and missing. Canons into off stump, could be too late for Bangladesh unless they get Morgan, though.
lunges forward and defends into the leg side
Morgan sweeps hard and effectively but there is a fielder at deep square and he can only get a single
good stuff from  Mahmudullah tight on the stumps and Bresnan can't get it away
Mahmudullah strikes! The crowd go wild! Another hideous swipe from an England lower-order batsman. Bresnan down on one knee trying to sweep this out the ground, misses and Bangladesh get the lbw
defends this tidily into the off side and collects one
well, Morgan attempts a big sweep but finds thin air, another dot ball
better from Morgan, keeps the strike with a collected dab down towards mid on. England's hopes rest of Morgan
with all the field up, Morgan aims a reverse-sweep and sets off for a quick single, it goes straight to the fielder who hurls back the throw but Swann is in
neat from Swann, not trying anything fancy, just prodding it into the midwicket region for a single
Morgan takes a couple of steps down the wicket and meets it on the full, can't time his leg-side forcing shot and collects one out to deep square
Shakib Al Hasan is turning this match on its head! Swann runs down the wicket and misses a swipe entirely, ends up being bowled. Not particularly clever from him, but huge for Bangladesh.
you'd think he's landing grenades, Tredwell very suspiciously prods at this outside off stump into the off side
Shakib finishes a fabulous spell, he's done all he can with the ball to give his side a chance
to pin-drop silence from the crowd, Morgan smashes this back down the ground for four, top shot
well bowled, yorker length and bang on the stumps, Morgan can only dig it out
nicely done from Shafiul again, massive pressure on him with the field up, lands another yorker and Morgan can only squeeze it out on to the leg side for another single
excellent bowling, really high quality stuff, on off stump, Tredwell can't get it away and pressure building
good bowling and excellent stuff from Tredwell too, angling this ball from just outside off stump down to third man for a lung-busting couple
slower ball to finish, which takes some guts, and Shafiul lands it well, Tredwell can't do much with that. Excellent finish to the over
well bowled, Morgan trying to give himself room and piece the off side ring, but can't beat mid off
full toss but Morgan times his shot into the leg side to the boundary fielders, and collects a couple
terrific stuff from Morgan, reverse-sweeps it perfectly, between the fielders for a boundary
lovely stuff from Morgan, really well played, skipping down the track and driving through mid off for three
well bowled, Tredwell can't get it away, prodding into the off side
not much Tredwell needs to do here, and he keeps it out well, Morgan will have the strike
this will help! Full toss smashed to deep square for another boundary, brilliant stuff from him, so calm under pressure
there it is, brilliant hundred from Morgan, but he does not even acknowledge it, he knows he's got work to do
oh dear, very close, Morgan swiping at a full ball outside off and missing
this is sterling stuff from Morgan, crisply smashes a full toss over cover for another boundary

Well there you go! Morgan finishes it style, clipping this high and handsomely over square leg for six! He's been so completely certain and controlled under pressure, fantastic batting. He becomes, incidentally, the first to make an ODI hundred for two nations.
